page.title: 01COVERACK VILLAGE
page.content: The village of{Coverack}is situated on the eastern side of the{Lizard {Peninsula}in West Cornwall, eleven miles from{Helston,}its nearest town. It is a village of contrasting houses, some of which are more than four- hundred years old, others of very recent construction. It has developed around a small eastward facing bay, to the south of which is a{picturesque {harbour.}The older part of the village, around the harbour area, is characterised by a number of houses which retain much of their{old-world {charm,}with whitewashed walls and thatched roofs. Some of these houses still bear evidence of the past, with {remains of hidden cupboards and rooms {used by smugglers}in days long gone. The occupants of these houses still lovingly retain the original exterior appearance of their homes.
